image.altText: A red and white passenger ferry docked in a bay with the blue sky in the background.

props.synopsis: Both of Tasmania's brand new Bass Strait ferries have "technical issues" with their LNG systems, the government says — adding to the list of problems which have plagued the ships.

title.children: Another problem for troubled Spirit of Tasmania ferries

image.altText: A woman stands on a rock and looks out at a beach.

props.synopsis: A 38-year-old Perth man had "significant levels" of drugs in his system, was inexperienced in free diving and was using ill-fitting gear when he drowned in 2024 in Tasmania, a coroner has found.

title.children: Inexperience, drugs, incorrect gear contributed to drowning, coroner finds

image.altText: People gathered for NAIDOC Rally. One lady holds a sign that reads 'Treaty'.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government will fund the establishment of truth-telling and healing commissioners, but it will no longer pursue a treaty with Tasmanian Aboriginal people.

title.children: Tasmanian government to drop treaty process and focus on truth-telling

image.altText: Sport underway inside proposed stadium.

props.synopsis: Another cost blow-out, ongoing roof concerns and a minister with many powers — the latest on Tasmania's AFL stadium and the government's fast-track laws to get it built.

title.children: Why the Hobart stadium cost has blown out again

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair in a composite with a woman with brunette hair.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Senator Jacqui Lambie has been re-elected, while Pauline Hanson's daughter Lee has missed out, as results are finalised from the May 3 federal election.

title.children: Lambie successful, Hanson misses out, as Senate results finalised

image.altText: Two caucasian-looking women with black t-shirts with Aboriginal flags stand on stage, one in sunglasses reads a speech

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian councillor says the Welcome to and Acknowledgement of Country being given at events the council is involved in should cease as they have "served their purpose".

title.children: 'Served their purpose': Move to dump Acknowledgement of Country

image.altText: Exterior signage at Hobart Private Hospital.

props.synopsis: Healthscope's financial situation has prompted concerns about the future of the Hobart Private Hospital, which treats more than 20,000 patients each year.

title.children: Urgent clarity requested on Hobart Private Hospital amid Healthscope woes

image.altText: Two politicians standing in parliament.

props.synopsis: Recent polling and Saturday's Legislative Council elections highlight problems for the Tasmanian Liberals, as Treasurer Guy Barnett prepares to hand down his first state budget this week.

title.children: Tasmanian government's woes compounded as budget day approaches

image.altText: An adult lies in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: The Healthscope collapse has exposed the often-conflicting goals between government responsibility for health services and subsidised, but privately run, institutions looking to maximise profit.

title.children: 'They've trashed the joint': Disastrous takeover sealed Healthscope's demise

image.altText: A car submerged in water next to a dock.

props.synopsis: A couple celebrating their 57th wedding anniversary have had to be rescued after their car drove off a dock and into the water as they attempted to board a ferry in Tasmania.

title.children: 'Quick thinking' ferry staff praised after rescuing couple from submerged car

image.altText: RBA building

props.synopsis: Consumer prices rose 2.4 per cent for the year to April, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics. It is the third month in a row that headline inflation rate has remained steady.

title.children: Odds remain on July rate cut as inflation stays on target

image.altText: Close up of a collection of jagged red rocks. In the background, two towers spitting flames.

props.synopsis: The federal government has green lighted the extension of Woodside's Karratha Gas Plant — this is what you need to know.

title.children: Woodside's massive WA gas project is being expanded — here's what that means

image.altText: A blond man and blonde woman stand shoulder-to-shoulder as they pose for photos

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says Todd and Julie Chrisley were dealt "a pretty harsh treatment" after being found guilty of tax evasion and bank fraud.

title.children: Trump to pardon reality stars who conspired to defraud banks of more than $30m

image.altText: Vladimir Putin chairs a meeting in the Kremlin wearing a black suit

props.synopsis: US president President Donald has become increasingly frustrated with his Russian counterpart over his actions in Ukraine, lashing out at him for the second time this week.

title.children: Trump warns Putin he is 'playing with fire' over Ukraine

image.altText: US bank notes pictured on a black background

props.synopsis: It is a threat to Australian borrowers on fixed-interest mortgages, and a concern for anyone with exposure to US assets, including through superannuation.

title.children: 'Panic' as dive in US dollar risks Australia's $4 trillion super pool

image.altText: A man standing in a room looks to his side, with a serious and focused expression. Part of his face and the room is in shadow.

props.synopsis: Former military lawyer David McBride has lost his appeal against the severity of his sentence for sharing classified documents with journalists.

title.children: Jailed whistleblower David McBride loses appeal against sentence

image.altText: A paramedic opens the hatch of an ambulance

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old Aboriginal man who died after being restrained by police in Alice Springs was from the remote community of Yuendumu.

title.children: NT major crimes unit investigates 24yo Yuendumu man's death in custody

image.altText: A man surrounded by emergency service workers holding a blanket and plastic bags.

props.synopsis: Emergency services have rescued a man from the bottom of a deep cave in the centre of a regional South Australian city.

title.children: Man pulled to safety after getting stuck in 30m deep sinkhole

image.altText: A rocket takes off leaving behind a thick plume of smoke

props.synopsis: The two-stage spacecraft, consisting of the Starship vessel mounted atop a towering SpaceX Super Heavy rocket booster, blasted off at about 7:36pm local time on Tuesday in Texas.

title.children: SpaceX Starship launches after two failures but tumbles out of control

image.altText: Australian golfer Minjee Lee holds a championship trophy above her head as she smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Australian golf superstar Minjee Lee arrives in Wisconsin for the second women's major of 2025 with renewed confidence after moving to a broomstick putter.

title.children: Minjee Lee eyeing third major at US Open

image.altText: A woman sitting behind a microphone in the ABC studio.

props.synopsis: Australian National University Vice-Chancellor Genevieve Bell confirms an external investigator will review allegations of "wildly inappropriate behaviour" within the College of Health and Medicine.

title.children: ANU open to firing staff over 'wildly inappropriate behaviour'

image.altText: An aerial shot of boat on water next to a sand bank

props.synopsis: A remote beach in WA offers a glimpse into the severity of plastic pollution in the world's oceans.

title.children: This WA beach looks pristine until you scratch the surface

image.altText: A middle aged white woman with long brown hair putting dentures in

props.synopsis: Patients across the country have been left with no teeth and drained superannuation accounts after clinics run by a NSW company were placed into administration.

title.children: No teeth, missing super: 'Nightmare' as 'predatory' dental clinics collapse

image.altText: a young woman wearing a hijab and glasses walks past a group of journalists

props.synopsis: The independent senator for WA says she made a formal complaint that was escalated to the Parliamentary Workplace Support Service.

title.children: Senator discloses 'inappropriate' behaviour by senior parliamentary colleague

image.altText: A smiling teenage girl with long, dark hair.

props.synopsis: Police say the Good Night Scrub National Park is not the only area of interest in their investigation into the 17-year-old's disappearance.

title.children: Police suspend bushland search for missing teen Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: John Pesutto and Moira Deeming in a composite image.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal premier Jeff Kennett is among three former Victorian Liberal leaders named in a legal letter from MP Moira Deeming about recovering legal costs from John Pesutto's financial backers.

title.children: Former premier Jeff Kennett blasts Moira Deeming for 'destructive' letter

image.altText: Two men stand back while another man wields a machete.

props.synopsis: Detectives say seven males aged between 15 and 21 have been arrested and charged over an allegedly planned gang fight with machetes at Northland shopping centre on Sunday.

title.children: Seven young males involved in 'planned' gang fight at Northland, police allege

image.altText: A blurry video screenshot shows a woman on the ground surrounded by several people and a man on the phone

props.synopsis: A violent assault in Sydney's east has sparked a 27,000-strong petition demanding tougher youth crime laws.

title.children: 'Deep anger and anxiety': Chinese community react to spate of alleged attacks

image.altText: Rhiannon DV Interview

props.synopsis: Rhiannon Purcell is fighting to extend an ADVO against her ex-husband — and she claims NSW Police and the courts have only let her down.

title.children: Victim-survivor fighting for her safety after her perpetrator's release from jail

image.altText: A man looks to up, to the side and out of frame with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Richard Boyle has faced the heavy price of being a whistleblower in Australia. It's time for urgent reforms of public and private sector whistleblower laws and the establishment of a new body to protect those who blow the whistle.

title.children: 'Richard Boyle is a superhero': So why didn't whistleblower laws protect him?

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of a man

props.synopsis: A former aide to Sean "Diddy" Combs testifies the hip-hop mogul threatened to kill her during her first day on the job and waved a gun as he kidnapped her years later in an angry rush to find and kill rapper Kid Cudi.

title.children: Diddy's ex-employee says she was kidnapped in rap mogul's plot to kill Kid Cudi

image.altText: Identical twins Danny and Michael Philippou pose for a photo, making funny faces in front of a neutral background.

props.synopsis: Aussie directors Danny and Michael Philippou are behind the $92 million smash-hit Talk to Me, but they won't be switching Adelaide for Hollywood. Now they're back with a gory new feature, once again exploring the horrors of teen life in suburbia.

title.children: Why the twins who became the talk of Hollywood are staying in Adelaide

image.altText: A young girl sitting next to a pile of rubble.

props.synopsis: Video of Ward Sheikh Khalil spread quickly around the world after an attack in a school in Gaza City killed her mother and five siblings.

title.children: This five-year-old girl walked through fire to escape an Israeli strike in Gaza

image.altText: A drone picture of Adelaide's Sam Way building, with other CBD buildings nearby.

props.synopsis: A former senior member of a South Australian church has been jailed and told he "should've known better" when he sexually assaulted a 14-year-old girl in the early 2000s.

title.children: 'Should've known better': Former senior church member sentenced for teen sex assault

image.altText: Three children crouch in long grass and smile

props.synopsis: The new faces of Harry Potter and his friends Ron and Hermione have been revealed.

title.children: Three newcomers cast as leads for Harry Potter reboot series
